programme.title: Comedy
programme.desc: Comedy shorts about love include ``Tinder Mercies,`` where two very special internet dating individuals meet; ``Eternal Love``; ``Mind F*#k``; ``Now Playing``; two cupids team up to get two strangers to chat in ``Cupids.``.

programme.title: Shorts in Love
programme.desc: Humorous, fantastical shorts about young love include ``Spaghetti,`` in which a young boy has an explosive reaction to a new girl at school; ``Dead Hearts`` is a charming gothic bedtime story involving a young mortician.

programme.title: Movie of the Week
programme.desc: In the dark comedy ``Requiem for a Crab,`` a young man tries to overcome the death of his foster father; also: ``Playground.``.

programme.title: World Cinema
programme.desc: Shorts full of suspense include ``Delay`` from Iran, in which a father and his children experience drama at the airport; South African film ``Gallo Rojo``; ``Vlado`` is inspired by the life of a Brazilian journalist who disappeared.

programme.title: Pure Drama

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: Films about troubled people on the road include ``Joe,`` where a cab driver must confront his personal demons; ``Under`` sees a relapsed drug addict and her fiancé head to a country cabin; also: ``The Sweet Hand of the White Rose.``.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: Films about kids under bad influences include Oscar winner ``Skin`` involving racial tensions and a gang war; a mom casts a shadow on her son's future in ``The Son, the Father``; things turn bad at ``The Garage.``.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: In ``A Brave Face,`` an abusive husband has no understanding for his wife's wish for a professional career; a composer tries to hide his daughter from a visitor in ``Chateau Belvedere.``.

programme.title: Midnight Horror
programme.desc: A selection of horror shorts, featuring ``Herd,`` where a woman wakes up in the home of her one-night-stand and senses danger, and ``It's In The Trees,`` which sees a gang of teenagers visit a meteorite impact site.

programme.title: Sex in Shorts
programme.desc: In ``Treacle,`` best friends Belle and Jessie go away for a drunken weekend; a loved-up Dutch teen is hunted by Nazis during World War II in ``Run Free.``.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: Presenting a drama about being trapped. In ``Icebox,`` a boy enters America's rigid immigration process, in ``Geeta,`` a woman comes to the US to work as a housemaid at an Indian diplomat's house, and ``One Day`` sees a young mother battling OCD.

programme.title: Pure Drama
programme.desc: Presenting stories about tough topics; included are ``Rose's Turn`` where a wealthy European couple working in L.A. invite a homeless woman for dinner, ``Testing Greta`` where a woman visits a doctor, ``Jenna``, and ``Goldfish.``.

programme.title: Comedy
programme.desc: Comedies about drama queens. In ``Can't Let It Go!`` a nostalgic pageant director holds model search competitions in her backyard every day, and in ``Becky Jane's Big Day`` a teenage girl's birthday doesn't go as planned.

programme.title: Animation
programme.desc: A collection of out-of-the-ordinary animations packed with imagination. Included are ``Touch,`` ``Land Without Evil,`` ``Many Chances,`` ``Moving Stones,`` ``YYCH1,`` ``YYCH2,`` ``Birthday,`` ``Form B16,`` ``Robo,`` and ``Junk Food.``.

programme.title: Short Docs
programme.desc: Documentaries about individuals who are extremely passionate about their hobbies include ``Rail Fan`` about fans of New York City's subway system, ``Underground`` about B-boys from the Bay Area, and ``Springloaded -- A Pinball Tale.``.

programme.title: Editor's Pick
programme.desc: A strange box is sold at an antique store in ``Inside the Grace``; ``The Gift`` gives a fallen woman a chance at a happy life; in ``Lethe,`` a woman escapes the hospital to investigate what happened to her.

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: Unauthorized to enter the United States, an Eastern European (Tom Hanks) befriends a flight attendant (Catherine Zeta-Jones) while living in a New York airport.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman
programme.desc: A hardened loner (Richard Gere) shapes up for a military drill instructor (Louis Gossett Jr.) and a factory girl (Debra Winger) from town.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: A woman (Blake Lively) who has miraculously remained young for nearly 80 years meets a charismatic philanthropist (Michiel Huisman) who reawakens her passion for life and romance.

programme.title: The Machinist
programme.desc: Cryptic notes and encounters with a mysterious stranger torment a drill-press operator (Christian Bale) who has not slept in a year.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Tormented by her peers and sheltered by her religious mother (Julianne Moore), an awkward teenager (Chloë Grace Moretz) unleashes her hidden, telekinetic powers after a sick prank at her senior prom pushes her over the edge.

programme.title: Dead Man Walking
programme.desc: A nun (Susan Sarandon) helps a double murderer (Sean Penn) deal with his actions and prepare for his execution in a New Orleans prison.

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: A young servant fleeing from his master takes refuge at a dysfunctional convent in medieval Tuscany, disguising himself as a deaf-mute.

programme.title: Body Cam
programme.desc: A police officer investigating the bizarre murder of a fellow officer discovers something supernatural is targeting the cops in her unit.

programme.title: The Terminal
programme.desc: Unauthorized to enter the United States, an Eastern European (Tom Hanks) befriends a flight attendant (Catherine Zeta-Jones) while living in a New York airport.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman
programme.desc: A hardened loner (Richard Gere) shapes up for a military drill instructor (Louis Gossett Jr.) and a factory girl (Debra Winger) from town.

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: A reporter (Robert Downey Jr.) befriends a mentally ill and homeless man (Jamie Foxx), once a student at Juilliard but now playing music on the streets of Los Angeles.

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: Col. Robert Gould Shaw (Matthew Broderick) trains and leads an all-black regiment during the U.S. Civil War.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: Father Khatri tells Boyd why he believes Sara may be useful; Jim and Tabitha find comfort in each other; Colony House celebrates the one-year anniversary of Fatima's arrival with a party that goes terribly wrong.

programme.title: A River Runs Through It
programme.desc: Two Montana boys become different men (Craig Sheffer, Brad Pitt) under the influence of fly-fishing and their minister father (Tom Skerritt).

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: A sports junkie (Keanu Reeves) agrees to coach Little League Baseball in Chicago in order to pay his gambling debts.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: From
programme.desc: Father Khatri tells Boyd why he believes Sara may be useful; Jim and Tabitha find comfort in each other; Colony House celebrates the one-year anniversary of Fatima's arrival with a party that goes terribly wrong.

programme.title: Escape From Alcatraz
programme.desc: Based on the true story of a hardened convict who engineered an elaborate plan to bust out of the famed prison in 1962.

programme.title: Rosewater
programme.desc: While covering an election protest in 2009 Iran, BBC journalist Maziar Bahari (Gael García Bernal) is arrested, imprisoned and tortured for nearly four months.

programme.title: The Prophecy: Forsaken
programme.desc: A lawman (Jason Scott Lee) tries to protect a young woman (Kari Wuhrer) who possesses a book that inhabitants of heaven and hell want.

programme.title: Breakdown
programme.desc: A man's (Kurt Russell) wife (Kathleen Quinlan) disappears in the desert Southwest after accepting a trucker's (J.T. Walsh) help with car trouble.

programme.title: Changeling
programme.desc: After her son is kidnapped and later found, a woman (Angelina Jolie) insists that the boy who was returned to her is not her child.

programme.title: Deerskin
programme.desc: A middle-aged drifter becomes obsessed with a fringed deerskin jacket that seems to hold mystical powers.

programme.title: Drillbit Taylor
programme.desc: Three friends hire a homeless soldier-of-fortune (Owen Wilson) to protect them from the school bully.

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again
programme.desc: Johnny English springs back into action when a hacker reveals the identities of undercover agents in Britain. As a man with few skills and analogue methods, Johnny must overcome the challenges of modern technology to make this mission a success.

programme.title: I Am Number Four
programme.desc: One of nine living on Earth, an alien (Alex Pettyfer) with extraordinary abilities poses as an ordinary teenager in the hope of evading those sent to kill him.

programme.title: The Devil's Double
programme.desc: Having been forced to act as a body double for one of Saddam Hussein's sons, Latif Yahia (Dominic Cooper) gives an insider's look at the life of the Iraqi tyrant.

programme.title: Basic Instinct 2: Risk Addiction
programme.desc: A criminal psychologist falls under the seductive spell of Catherine Trammell (Sharon Stone), who re-emerges in London on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: Strange events take place after a family (Ryan Reynolds, Melissa George, Jesse James) moves into a new house that was the site of several gruesome murders.

programme.title: The Prophecy: Uprising
programme.desc: A woman (Kari Wuhrer) must protect an ancient religious manuscript from renegade angels.

programme.title: Master of the Nine Dragon Fist: Wong Ching-Ho
programme.desc: A martial artist develops a new form of kung fu to fight opium traders.

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: King Leonidas (Sean Maguire) and his strapping warriors rise up to defend Sparta from invading Persians, bad punch-lines and celebrity look-alikes.

programme.title: The Out-of-Towners
programme.desc: An Ohio couple (Steve Martin, Goldie Hawn) reinvigorate their passionless marriage during a bizarre 24 hours in New York City.

programme.title: I'm Gonna Git You Sucka
programme.desc: A veteran (Keenen Ivory Wayans), his idol (Bernie Casey) and other ghetto good guys battle a white mobster called Mr. Big.

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A contract killer (Tom Cruise) hijacks a cab and forces the driver (Jamie Foxx) to transport him to his assigned jobs in Los Angeles.

programme.title: Riddick
programme.desc: Left for dead on a sun-scorched planet, wanted criminal Riddick (Vin Diesel) must confront two teams of mercenaries, one of whom is led by a man from his past.

programme.title: The Internship
programme.desc: Two old-school, unemployed salesmen (Vince Vaughn, Owen Wilson) finagle internships at Google, then must compete with younger, smarter candidates for prime positions.

programme.title: Repentance
programme.desc: A disturbed client (Forest Whitaker) uses torture to coerce a self-help author (Anthony Mackie) into confessing his untold crimes.

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A hotel owner (John Cleese) devises a contest where six Las Vegas gamblers (Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg) frantically search for a bag containing $2 million.

programme.title: The Core
programme.desc: In order to save mankind, scientists and astronauts must set off a nuclear device at the center of the Earth.

programme.title: Hellbenders
programme.desc: Under orders from their vulgar leader (Clancy Brown), clerics commit sins to help them drag demons back to hell.

programme.title: The Prophecy
programme.desc: Gabriel (Christopher Walken) and other angels jealous of humanity wage war using a police detective (Elias Koteas) and the soul of a Korean War veteran.

programme.title: The Prophecy II
programme.desc: A fallen angel (Christopher Walken) tries to prevent the birth of a child who will save mankind from the forces of evil.

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: In 1805 a British captain (Russell Crowe) and his crew endure hardships while trying to prevent a French ship from reaching the Pacific Ocean.

programme.title: Raw Deal
programme.desc: A former FBI agent (Arnold Schwarzenegger) infiltrates the biggest mob in Chicago and single-handedly wipes it out.

programme.title: Waist Deep
programme.desc: An ex-convict (Tyrese Gibson) collides with members of a street gang after his car is stolen with his son inside.

programme.title: The Prince
programme.desc: A retired assassin is drawn back into his former life and a confrontation with an old rival when his daughter is kidnapped.

programme.title: Sliver
programme.desc: A book editor (Sharon Stone) has an affair with a voyeur (William Baldwin) in her building, a Manhattan murder scene wired for video.

programme.title: Larry Crowne
programme.desc: Unemployed after a round of corporate downsizing, a middle-aged man (Tom Hanks) enrolls in college and meets a teacher (Julia Roberts) who has lost her passion for her job and her husband.

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: A post-apocalyptic mercenary (Vin Diesel) guards a nun (Michelle Yeoh) and her young charge (Mélanie Thierry), who may be mankind's last hope for survival.

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: Mulder (David Duchovny) and Scully (Gillian Anderson) encounter a priest (Billy Connolly) with psychic visions when they reunite to solve a baffling missing-persons case.

programme.title: Stoker
programme.desc: After the tragic death of a girl's father, an eccentric uncle comes to live with the teen (Mia Wasikowska) and her unstable mother (Nicole Kidman). Though she suspects the man has ulterior motives, she becomes increasingly infatuated with him.

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: At a rundown desert motel, a woman (Ashley Judd) begins a tentative relationship with a newcomer (Michael Shannon), which quickly degenerates into paranoia after the man insists that he has tiny insects under his skin.

programme.title: Hangman
programme.desc: A detective and a criminal profiler pursue a serial killer whose crimes are inspired by a children's game called hangman.

programme.title: Cinderella Man
programme.desc: Despite a string of losses and injuries, boxer Jim Braddock (Russell Crowe) makes a dramatic comeback and faces champion Max Baer.

programme.title: The Prince
programme.desc: A retired assassin is drawn back into his former life and a confrontation with an old rival when his daughter is kidnapped.

programme.title: The Crying Game
programme.desc: Irish Republican Army member Fergus (Stephen Rea) forms an unexpected bond with Jody (Forest Whitaker), a kidnapped British soldier in his custody, despite the warnings of fellow IRA members Jude (Miranda Richardson) and Maguire (Adrian Dunbar). Jody makes Fergus promise he'll visit his girlfriend, Dil (Jaye Davidson), in London, and when Fergus flees to the city, he seeks her out. Hounded by his former IRA colleagues, he finds himself increasingly drawn to the enigmatic, and surprising, Dil.

programme.title: Domino
programme.desc: In this film loosely based on a true story, Domino Harvey (Keira Knightley), a former model, is now a bounty hunter who has been arrested for robbing an armored car. During interrogation, she claims innocence and tells her story. Harvey became a pupil of Ed Moseby (Mickey Rourke), who ran a course for aspiring bounty hunters. Along with Choco (Edgar Ramírez), the three of them became a successful team. But, when a bail bondsman (Delroy Lindo) offered a job, they faced a complicated frame-up.

programme.title: Endings, Beginnings
programme.desc: A Los Angeles woman unlocks the secrets to her life after meeting two handsome best friends at a party.

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: Aimless David Rice (Hayden Christensen) has the ability to instantly transport himself to any place he can imagine. He uses that gift to globe-trot, living on money he steals by "jumping" into bank vaults. He's captured by the evil Roland Cox (Samuel L. Jackson), who knows how to keep David from jumping. David escapes and reunites with his high school crush, Millie (Rachel Bilson), then forms an alliance with fellow jumper Griffin (Jamie Bell) and prepares for mortal combat with Cox.

programme.title: Bad News Bears
programme.desc: Morris Buttermaker (Billy Bob Thornton) is a burned-out minor league baseball player who loves to drink and can't keep his hands to himself. His long-suffering lawyer (Marcia Gay Harden) arranges for him to manage a local Little League team, and Buttermaker soon finds himself the head of a rag-tag group of misfit players. Through unconventional team-building exercises and his offbeat coaching style, Buttermaker helps his hapless Bears prepare to meet their rivals, the Yankees.

programme.title: Coneheads
programme.desc: Cone-headed extraterrestrials Beldar (Dan Aykroyd) and Prymaat (Jane Curtin) find themselves in New Jersey after a recon mission for their home planet of Remulak goes awry. Stranded, they are forced to live as typical suburban humans. Beldar gets a job, and daughter Connie (Michelle Burke) grows up to be a typical, if oddly shaped, teenager. When INS agents start investigating the family and Beldar receives sinister orders from Remulak, the Coneheads must decide where their allegiance lies.

programme.title: Adventureland
programme.desc: It's the summer of 1987, and recent college grad James Brennan (Jesse Eisenberg) can't wait to begin his long-anticipated dream trip to Europe. Unfortunately, James' plans come to a screeching halt when his parents announce that they are unable to subsidize his trip. Forced to take a job at the local amusement park, James prepares for the worst summer ever, until he finds love with a captivating co-worker named Em (Kristen Stewart).

programme.title: At Close Range
programme.desc: Based on a true story, "At Close Range" follows the lives of the Whitewood family in rural Pennsylvania. Brothers Brad Jr. (Sean Penn) and Tommy (Chris Penn) are the sons of organized crime leader Brad Sr. (Christopher Walken), who draws his sons into his life of crime. After starting their own gang, Brad Jr. and Tommy are arrested in a failed robbery attempt, and are forced to face the truth: that their father will do anything to avoid being arrested for his crimes.

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three small-town friends, Alexandra (Cher), Jane (Susan Sarandon) and Sukie (Michelle Pfeiffer), each having lost the man in their lives, are feeling unfulfilled -- until a furtive stranger, Daryl Van Horne (Jack Nicholson), arrives and begins courting each of them in turn. Eventually, Daryl tells them that they are witches. But as the three friends spend more time at his mansion, enjoying themselves and learning about their powers, they begin to worry about Daryl's ultimate intentions.

programme.title: Life of Pi
programme.desc: After deciding to sell their zoo in India and move to Canada, Santosh and Gita Patel board a freighter with their sons and a few remaining animals. Tragedy strikes when a terrible storm sinks the ship, leaving the Patels' teenage son, Pi (Suraj Sharma), as the only human survivor. However, Pi is not alone; a fearsome Bengal tiger has also found refuge aboard the lifeboat. As days turn into weeks and weeks drag into months, Pi and the tiger must learn to trust each other if both are to survive.

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Failed college coach Norman Dale (Gene Hackman) gets a chance at redemption when he is hired to direct the basketball program at a high school in a tiny Indiana town. After a teacher (Barbara Hershey) persuades star player Jimmy Chitwood to quit and focus on his long-neglected studies, Dale struggles to develop a winning team in the face of community criticism for his temper and his unconventional choice of assistant coach: Shooter (Dennis Hopper), a notorious alcoholic.

programme.title: Johnny English Strikes Again
programme.desc: The new adventure begins when a cyberattack reveals the identities of all active undercover agents in Britain, leaving Johnny English as the secret service's last hope. Called out of retirement, English dives headfirst into action with the mission to find the mastermind hacker. As a man with few skills and analogue methods, Johnny English must overcome the challenges of modern technology to make this mission a success.

programme.title: Serving Sara
programme.desc: When Sara (Elizabeth Hurley) is served divorce papers while she is in New York, she is stunned. Not about to lose the fortune she amassed with her self-serving Texan husband, she makes an offer to her process server, Joe (Matthew Perry), that sets them off on a wild trip across the country.

programme.title: Babylon A.D.
programme.desc: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a battle-hardened mercenary, Toorop (Vin Diesel), lives by his own code and the credo kill or be killed. His latest assignment is to escort a young woman named Aurora (Mélanie Thierry) and her guardian, Sister Rebeka (Michelle Yeoh), from Kazakhstan to New York. Facing danger at each turn, Toorop begins to realize that Aurora represents the last hope for mankind's survival.

programme.title: This Is 40
programme.desc: After many years of marriage, Pete (Paul Rudd) is the sole male in a household that includes his wife, Debbie (Leslie Mann), and two young daughters (Iris Apatow, Maude Apatow). As Pete struggles to keep his record label afloat, he and Debbie navigate a three-week course of sex and romance, career victories and financial hardships, aging parents and maturing children. They'll have to learn to forgive, forget and enjoy the rest of their lives -- before they kill each other.

programme.title: The X-Files
programme.desc: In a small Texas town, a mysterious black substance emanating from the remains of a prehistoric human engulfs a young boy and his rescuers. Later, FBI agents Fox Mulder (David Duchovny) and Dana Scully (Gillian Anderson) are in Dallas to disarm a bomb set to detonate inside a federal facility. Unfortunately the bomb explodes -- leaving four inside dead. Mulder and Scully then receive a tip that the disaster was a government effort to cover-up an alien virus linked to the boy's death.

programme.title: The Birdcage
programme.desc: In this remake of the classic French farce "La Cage aux Folles," engaged couple Val Goldman (Dan Futterman) and Barbara Keeley (Calista Flockhart) shakily introduce their future in-laws. Val's father, Armand (Robin Williams), a gay Miami drag club owner, pretends to be straight and attempts to hide his relationship with Albert (Nathan Lane), his life partner and the club's flamboyant star attraction, so as to please Barbara's father, controversial Republican Sen. Kevin Keeley (Gene Hackman).

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Lovable Englishman Charles (Hugh Grant) and his group of friends seem to be unlucky in love. When Charles meets a beautiful American named Carrie (Andie MacDowell) at a wedding, he thinks his luck may have changed. But, after one magical night, Carrie returns to the States, ending what might have been. As Charles and Carrie's paths continue to cross -- over a handful of nuptials and one funeral -- he comes to believe they are meant to be together, even if their timing always seems to be off.

programme.title: Larry Crowne
programme.desc: Once well-respected at his company, Larry Crowne (Tom Hanks) finds himself on the unemployment line after a wave of corporate downsizing. Drowning in debt and unsure of what to do with his life, Larry enrolls in college, where he becomes part of a community of misfits who are all trying to carve out a better future. The possibility of romance enters the picture when Larry meets Mercedes Tainot (Julia Roberts), an instructor who has lost her passion for both teaching and her marriage.

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: Childhood friends Conner (Andy Samberg), Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) found fame and fortune after forming the hip-hop group the Style Boyz. Owen and Lawrence faded into the background when frontman Conner left the band to launch a successful solo career. Now, the egotistical singer decides to film a documentary about his life while he's still on top. When his second album flops, the camera is there to capture his world come crashing down.

programme.title: Kajillionaire
programme.desc: Two con artists have spent 26 years training their only daughter to swindle, scam and steal at every turn. During a desperate and hastily conceived heist, they charm a stranger into joining them, only to have their entire world turned upside down.

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: FBI criminal profiler Will Graham (William L. Petersen) is called out of early retirement to assist on a serial murder case involving a killer known as the "Tooth Fairy" (Tom Noonan). Graham enlists the help of imprisoned serial killer -- and cannibal -- Dr. Hannibal Lecktor (Brian Cox), who is the reason Graham took an early retirement. Soon, Graham and the FBI are entangled in a deadly cat-and-mouse game between the Tooth Fairy, Lecktor and an interfering journalist (Stephen Lang).

actor.role: FBI Agent Will Graham (as William Petersen)

programme.title: Dolapo Is Fine
programme.desc: A young Black woman faces pressure to change her name and hairstyle.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: This charming account of a period in the life of author J.M. Barrie (Johnny Depp) reveals the real relationships and events that served as the basis for the author's most iconic work, "Peter Pan." After Barrie develops a platonic relationship with the widowed Sylvia (Kate Winslet) and her four sons, he is inspired to write a play about a group of children who don't want to grow up. The work proves a hit and winds up bringing Barrie and the children together in a way he had never expected.

programme.title: Igby Goes Down
programme.desc: Igby Slocumb (Kieran Culkin), a rebellious and sarcastic 17-year-old boy, is at war with the stifling world of old money privilege he was born into. With a schizophrenic father (Bill Pullman), a self-absorbed, distant mother (Susan Sarandon), and a shark-like young Republican big brother (Ryan Phillippe), Igby figures there must be a better life out there -- and sets about finding it.

programme.title: The Clearing
programme.desc: Wayne Hayes (Robert Redford) and his wife, Eileen (Helen Mirren), seem to have it all. Over the years, they've built a prosperous business together while raising their two children, Tim and Jill. But the family's dream life becomes nightmarish when disgruntled employee Arnold Mack (Willem Dafoe) kidnaps Wayne and holds him for ransom. The FBI invades their home and scrutinizes every detail of their life -- and ultimately, it is left to Eileen to deliver the ransom and rescue her husband.

programme.title: Si
programme.desc: A day in the life of a young Asian-American.

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: Tom (Ashton Kutcher) and Sarah (Brittany Murphy) are two lovebirds from different worlds. He's an average guy with a fondness for beer who works a low-level job, while she's an aspiring writer from a wealthy and cultured family. The disapproval of family and friends doesn't prevent the pair from marrying, but their disastrous honeymoon in Italy, with an unwelcome appearance by Sarah's ex-boyfriend, Peter (Christian Kane), nearly succeeds in tearing them apart.

programme.title: Dolapo Is Fine
programme.desc: A young Black woman faces pressure to change her name and hairstyle.

programme.title: War Horse
programme.desc: Albert (Jeremy Irvine) and his beloved horse, Joey, live on a farm in the British countryside. At the outbreak of World War I, Albert and Joey are forcibly parted when Albert's father sells the horse to the British cavalry. Against the backdrop of the Great War, Joey begins an odyssey full of danger, joy and sorrow, and he transforms everyone he meets along the way. Meanwhile Albert, unable to forget his equine friend, searches the battlefields of France to find Joey and bring him home.

programme.title: Doubt
programme.desc: In 1964 the winds of change are sweeping through Sister Aloysius' (Meryl Streep) St. Nicholas school. Father Flynn (Philip Seymour Hoffman), a charismatic priest, is advocating reform of the school's strict customs, and the first black student has just been accepted. When a fellow nun (Amy Adams) tells Sister Aloysius that Father Flynn may be paying too much personal attention to the student, Sister Aloysius begins a personal crusade against the priest -- despite her lack of evidence.

programme.title: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: For Dan Gallagher (Michael Douglas), life is good. He is on the rise at his New York law firm, is happily married to his wife, Beth (Anne Archer), and has a loving daughter. But, after a casual fling with a sultry book editor named Alex (Glenn Close), everything changes. Jilted by Dan, Alex becomes unstable, her behavior escalating from aggressive pursuit to obsessive stalking. Dan realizes that his main problem is not hiding his affair, but rather saving himself and his family.

programme.title: 28 Weeks Later
programme.desc: Six months after the original epidemic, the rage virus has all but annihilated the population of the British Isles. Nevertheless the U.S. Army declares the danger past, and American soldiers arrive to restore order and begin reconstruction. Refugees return to British soil, but one of them carries a deadly secret: The virus is not gone and is even more dangerous than before.

programme.title: The Way, Way Back
programme.desc: Duncan (Liam James) is an awkward teen who must spend the summer at a beach house with his mother (Toni Collette), her boyfriend, Trent (Steve Carell), and Trent's obnoxious daughter. Trent can't resist badgering Duncan, so the youth steals away to a water park and gets a job that will help him stay off Trent's radar. As Duncan tends to the slides and pools of the aging park, he finds a father figure in wisecracking park manager Owen (Sam Rockwell) at a time when he desperately needs one.

programme.title: Joe
programme.desc: The rough-hewn boss (Nicolas Cage) of a lumber crew courts trouble when he steps in to protect the youngest member (Tye Sheridan) of his team from an abusive father.

programme.title: Anger Management
programme.desc: Dave Buznik (Adam Sandler) is usually a mild-mannered nonconfrontational guy. But after an altercation aboard an airplane, he is remanded to the care of an anger-management therapist, Dr. Buddy Rydell (Jack Nicholson), who could probably use a little anger management himself.

programme.title: Mash-Up Our Home
programme.desc: Torn between colorful style and neutral minimalism, a couple can't agree on how to renovate the tiny kitchen and unused garage in their bungalow; Kele and Christina come up with a harmonious design without either homeowner having to give an inch.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous: Welcome Inn
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny push to complete what has become the most-difficult renovation of their careers; with long nights ahead and the end in sight, they unexpectedly uncover some hidden history that reminds them why they chose to save this home.

programme.title: 100 Day Dream Home
programme.desc: After losing her husband, a single mother decides to seize the day by building a dream home to springboard her new culinary career; Mika springs for a kitchen fit for a chef, but Brian encounters major obstacles before they can get to work.

programme.title: Building Off the Grid
programme.desc: An overworked gymnastics coach begins working on his dream cabin in Utah's Wasatch Mountain Range; malfunctioning equipment, being far from town, extreme weather, and unpredictable wildlife threaten to turn his dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous: Welcome Inn
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny push to complete what has become the most-difficult renovation of their careers; with long nights ahead and the end in sight, they unexpectedly uncover some hidden history that reminds them why they chose to save this home.

programme.title: 100 Day Dream Home
programme.desc: After losing her husband, a single mother decides to seize the day by building a dream home to springboard her new culinary career; Mika springs for a kitchen fit for a chef, but Brian encounters major obstacles before they can get to work.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.desc: A mother wants to fulfill her late husband's dream of turning their outdated home into a modern farmhouse; Dave and Jenny bring that dream to life with a basketball court for the kids and some fun personal touches that the family can enjoy.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.sub-title: New Tudor Home in Time for a Newborn
programme.desc: A couple is ecstatic to learn that they are expecting another child, but now they need more space in their Tudor-style home; Dave and Jenny jump at the chance to create a full-blown Cotswold cottage with an open layout for this hip, young family.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.sub-title: Funky, Modern Home With a Pool
programme.desc: A father wants to turn his half-finished bachelor pad into a modern home for entertaining that reflects his style; Dave and Jenny update the house to match his prized pool and enlist his daughter's skills to paint a special finishing touch.

programme.title: Fixer to Fabulous
programme.desc: A couple host a lot of international students in their home, and they need Dave and Jenny's help with transforming their small ranch into a welcoming, worldly and eclectic place where visitors and family members can gather.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Brian and Sarah create a backyard for Pam and Kevin that matches their lush forest surroundings, complete with a double wrap-around deck and a hot tub; the team also builds a workshop for Kevin to perfect his craft of leather tooling.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Creative couple Farzana and Reyan have maxed out all living space in their city-sized bungalow, leaving no room for Reyan's home stained glass business or Farzana's writing; Brian and Sarah build a spacious studio and an inspiring deck area.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Breanna and Nick's life revolves around socializing and physical activity; Brian and Sarah convert an old, underused shed into a beautiful zen yoga studio and areas for partying, lounging, and dining in the backyard.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Brian and Sarah build a colorful play-land getaway for both children to grow with, while also providing Sandra and David a decked out BBQ zone and dining area.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Brian and Sarah create a flexible structure to cater towards both Aarati, Dave, and their daughters Naya and Zoey; they also install a sleek plunge pool and create an outdoor fireplace lounge.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Carly and Nate's social media star dog, Dean the Basset Hound, has a lot of four-legged friends; Brian and Sarah create a bar and lounge that provides space for pet and owner gatherings alike, along with a stylish outdoor entertainment area.

programme.title: Backyard Builds
programme.desc: Sonia and Paul are big social connectors in their community; Brian and Sarah turn their barren backyard into a social hotspot, complete with sunroom, giant chessboard, waterfall, and stylish outdoor entertainment spaces.
